sentence.text: Keppen-Lubinsky syndrome (KPLBS) is a rare disease mainly characterized by severe developmental delay and intellectual disability, microcephaly, large prominent eyes, a narrow nasal bridge, a tented upper nuclear-transcribed mRNA catabolic process, nonsense-mediated decay, a high palate, an open mouth, tightly adherent skin, an aged appearance, and severe generalized nuclear-transcribed mRNA catabolic process, nonsense-mediated decayodystrophy.
